Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: Routine servicing is scheduled next week during a planned shutdown.
Situation2: They strictly follow a detailed schedule of daily prayers, chanting, and offerings, ensuring nothing is skipped.
Story:
I glanced at the maintenance schedule pinned to the workshop wall, my name highlighted for next week’s planned shutdown. As the lead machine repairer, everyone expected me to oversee the cleaning and servicing—no shortcuts, no delays. The machines had to be spotless, every bolt checked, every filter replaced. It was my responsibility to keep the factory running smoothly, and I took pride in that.

But next week was also special in my Hindu calendar. My daily rituals would be longer and more elaborate, with extra prayers, chanting, and offerings. I had promised myself and my family that I would not skip a single step, not even for a day. The thought of missing a ritual filled me with guilt and anxiety; my faith was the anchor of my life.

As the days drew closer, I felt the pressure mounting. My supervisor reminded me of the importance of the shutdown, while my mother gently placed the prayer schedule on my bedside table. I lay awake at night, torn between the demands of my work and the sacred rhythm of my faith, unsure how I could possibly honor both.
